intro: Eriogonum praebens, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Eriogonum praebens is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
